snippet: An opposition case that was given little chance of succeeding ended up enlisting 26 states and securing some significant political and legal victories.
abstract: Band of Republican attorneys general, who filed a constitutional challenge to Pres Obama's health care law after it was signed in March 2010, can claim significant victories--both legal and political--in the wake of the Supreme Court's landmark ruling upholding the law; opposition case that was given little chance of succeeding ended up enlisting 26 states.

byline.original: By KEVIN SACK and ERIC LICHTBLAU

lead_paragraph: An opposition case that was given little chance of succeeding ended up enlisting 26 states and securing some significant political and legal victories.

headline.seo: For Attorneys General, Health Law Long Shot Brings Payoffs
headline.main: For Attorneys General, Long Shot Brings Payoffs
headline.print_headline: For Attorneys General, a Long Shot On Health Care Law Brings Payoffs

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
